org.jpws.pwslib.order

Class OrderedRecordList

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.order.OrderedRecordList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PwsFileListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FilterRecordList

    public class OrderedRecordList
extends java.lang.Object
implements PwsFileListener
    Represents an ordered list of DefaultRecordWrapper objects which may (or may not) belong to a specific, singular PwsRecordList. List altering actions, like insertion and removal of records or loading of a database, preserve the order of the list. Record-wrappers may be addressed by their index numbers in the list.

    The design of this class is to function as a "middleware" between a record database object and any record aware data model which needs reference to a sorted order of its items. The OrderedRecordList hereby listens to modification events of the underlying database and transforms them into events of the sorted list. This class may, however, also be used for simpler (or likewise more complex) purposes of sorting records as the bondage to a database is not mandatory.

    The sorting follows a fixed combination of values, namely GROUP + TITLE. Sorting follows the Collator class to guarantee locale sensitive sorting success.

    This class issues events for OrderedListListeners to reflect any list modifications. At the same time this class is a PwsFileListener and - if records were loaded from a Pws record list - it listens to modifications of this database and aligns the elements of this list accordingly. This design allows to update even complex display component arrangements by simply modifying the underlying record database.

    Since:
    0-3-0

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrderedRecordList

        public OrderedRecordList()
        Constructor for an ordered record list without database bondage for the current default locale.

      • OrderedRecordList

        public OrderedRecordList(java.util.Locale locale)
        Constructor for an ordered record list without database bondage for the specified locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - activated locale for sorting

      • OrderedRecordList

        public OrderedRecordList(PwsRecordList f)
        Constructor for an ordered record list which is related to a PwsRecordList object. The current VM default locale is used for sorting records.

        Note: In order to load data from and listen to a record list the method loadDatabase() must be called once. The constructor however determines database bondage of this object.

        Parameters:
        f - the PwsRecordList to which the records of this odered list must belong

      • OrderedRecordList

        public OrderedRecordList(PwsRecordList f,
                         java.util.Locale locale)
        Constructor for an ordered record list which is related to a PwsRecordList object and which is sorted after the specified locale.

        Note: In order to load data from and listen to a record list the method loadDatabase() must be called once. The constructor however determines database bondage of this object.

        Parameters:
        f - the PwsRecordList to which the records of this odered list must belong
        locale - activated locale for sorting

    • Method Detail

      • clearBondage

        protected void clearBondage(PwsRecord rec)
        Tests if the parameter record complys with database bondage of this list. (Does not remove bondage!) In case of non-compliance an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        rec - record to be evaluated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - ("unrelated record") if bondage violation

      • insertItem

        public void insertItem(DefaultRecordWrapper record)
        Inserts an element into this list. If this list is bound to a PwsRecordList object, the record must be an element of it.

        WARNING!! Applying this when this list has bondage may lead to de-synchronization of list and database. This method does not insert a record into the database.

        Parameters:
        record - record to be inserted as DefaultRecordWrapper
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the record fails to conform

      • insertRecordIntern

        protected void insertRecordIntern(DefaultRecordWrapper wrap)
        Inserts a record representation object into the sorted list without clearing file bondage and without issuing OrderedListEvent.
        Parameters:
        wrap - record representation object

      • loadDatabase

        public void loadDatabase(PwsRecordList list,
                         long expireScope)
        Loads a list of PwsRecords from a PwsRecordList object by discarding any previous content. If this object is bound to a PwsFile, the parameter list must also be a PwsFile and have an identical resource file (persistent file). If this object is not bound to a database, this method does, however, not lead to bondage, regardless of the instance type of list.

        This method makes this object listen to the parameter record list for content change events.

        Parameters:
        list - database to be loaded
        expireScope - time span in milliseconds for expire-soon status of records; 0 for ignore
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter does not fit the bound dbf

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Reloads (resorts) the content of the record list (which was last loaded by use of loadDatabase(). This is an expensive operation and will cause a LIST_RELOADED event. Does nothing if there was no list loaded.
        Since:
        2-0-0

      • makeRecordWrapper

        public DefaultRecordWrapper makeRecordWrapper(PwsRecord rec,
                                              java.util.Locale locale)
        The default function used by this class to create wrappers for records. May be overridden by user applications to supply a specific record wrapper type (which must be a subclass of DefaultRecordWrapper).
        Parameters:
        rec -
        locale -
        Returns:
        DefaultRecordWrapper containing the argument record

        public int size()
        The number of elements in this list.

        public DefaultRecordWrapper getItemAt(int index)
        Returns an element record (wrapper) of this list from its sequence index.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        DefaultRecordWrapper if index is in defined range, or null otherwise

      • getGroup

        public DefaultRecordWrapper[] getGroup(java.lang.String group,
                                       boolean exact)
        Returns the set of records that belong to the specified GROUP value. (returns original listed wrapper objects.)
        Parameters:
        group - selective group value; if null an empty array is returned
        exact - whether select value must be a complete existing group name
        Returns:
        array of DefaultRecordWrapper
        Since:
        0-4-0

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        index position or -1 of the record is unknown

      • removeItem

        public void removeItem(int index)
        Removes the element at a specified index position from this list. Does nothing if index is out of range.

        WARNING!! Applying this method when this list has bondage may lead to de-synchronization of list and database. This method does not remove a record from the database.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all elements from this list.

      • clearIntern

      • setExpireScope

        public void setExpireScope(long time)
        Sets the time scope for which level EXPIRE_SOON of wrapper records EXPIRY status is set. This method recalculates the status of all records; the start time of the scope is the actual system time.
        Parameters:
        time - time span in milliseconds
